Please unsubscribe me from this newsgroup

-----Original Message-----
From: Shane Duan [mailto:sduan@...]
Sent: Thursday, October 18, 2001 1:35 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] Assert as a keyword in JDK1.4 Beta 2


This might sound crazy but it works.

Pre-condition:  A refratoring tool and you have a super testcase for all
your
test cases.

1. Create the assert methods in your super class.
2. Rebuild the whole project
3. Use the refratoring tool to rename the assert methods in your super class
to
assertTrue.
4. Remove the assert methods from your super class.

Or maybe just do it directly on JUnit source base (In junit.framework.Assert
class), but I don't know about the license enough to know if this is
illegal.

Shane
